title: Bug 37021 - Source path incorrect in declare warning on binary files
description: Bug 37021 - Source path incorrect in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]. See tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. for code to run to see the problem. Limitations of the tests: These tests return false positives when detecting this error because filename checking is not enabled in harness verification of messages. (I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes no sense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.)
OB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' rather than 'app/Main'. I have also seen the filenames not appear at all, but these tests do not reproduce that problem.
EB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath should be listed in the form 'app/Main' instead of 'app.Main.class'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Run the code located at tests/new/binaryWarnings/..
2. Observe the declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars.
3. Note the incorrect listing of sourcepath as 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'.
